article_title: SNCF, Deutsche Bahn Cleared in 2002 Train-Fire Deaths, AFP Says
article_text: SHARE THIS ARTICLE   Share   Tweet   Post   Email  {"contentId":"LLAL4R1A74E901","position":"brokerboxarticle","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[120,60]],"small_desktop":[[120,60]],"tablet":[[120,60]]},"strategy":"viewable","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"brokerboxarticle1","url":"/news/articles/2011-05-16/sncf-deutsche-bahn-cleared-in-2002-train-fire-deaths-afp-says"},"containerId":"brokerboxarticle-hYqNK2J"}   Societe Nationale des Chemins de Fer Francais and Deutsche Bahn AG were cleared by a French court of charges of manslaughter and causing injuries in a 2002 fire on a Paris-to-Munich train that killed 12, Agence France-Presse reported, citing a lawyer for some of the victims’ families.    A conductor was found guilty and received a suspended sentence of one year for alerting his colleagues, rather than trying to put out the flames, when clothing hung near a heating board caught fire, AFP said.    Deutsche Bahn, Germany’s state-owned railway, has installed some safety equipment following the incident, the Berlin-based company said today in a statement that took note of the French court ruling clearing the German train operator.     Published on ‎16‎ ‎May‎, ‎2011‎ ‎16‎:‎35        Have a confidential tip for our reporters? GET IN TOUCH    Before it's here, it's on the Bloomberg Terminal.
